newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Sayansk Aluminium plans to export 85 pct of output.
newsitem.headline: Sayansk Aluminium plans to export 85 pct of output.

text.p: Sayansk Aluminimum chief executive Oleg Deripaska said on Friday the company expected to export 85 percent of its planned output of 327,000 tonnes of primary aluminium.
"Tolling is about 85 percent of our output," he told a news conference. Referring to future years, he added, "I expect tolling to decrease but I cannot predict by how much."
Technical director Viktor Geintse said all primary aluminium that Sayansk produced by tolling was exported and that this was its entire primary aluminium export activity.
Both men said deliveries of primary aluminium to the foil-making subsidiary Sayanal would probably increase.
Deripaska predicted domestic sales would be between 45,000 and 48,000 tonnes in 1996.

Sayansk board member Lyubov Gorokhova said alumina output at Kazakhstan's Pavlodar Alumina, a major supplier to Sayansk, had increased to 95,000 tonnes per month. In 1993, it was 35,000 tonnes a month.
Trans-World Metals Group, a London-based metals company, is a major shareholder in both Pavlodar and Sayansk.
